title: Accidental shooting in Joplin leaves 19-year-old dead
content:
Error loading player: No playable sources found
JOPLIN, Mo.
Last Friday, around four in the afternoon, Newton County Sheriff's deputies responded to a report of a shot being fired at home on the 4300 block of Connecticut Avenue in Joplin.
Upon arrival officers found a 19-year-old woman, Jona Rosson, with a gun shot wound to the abdomen. Deputies say the victim's husband was attempting first aid. She was rushed to Mercy Hospital where she was later pronounced dead.
Officers believe it to be an accidental shooting, but it is still undergoing investigation.
